definition: Measures the degree to which individuals endorse different moral foundations: care, fairness, loyalty, authority, and purity.
Assesses how sacred or inviolable different moral values are to an individual.
Evaluates ethical ideologies along dimensions of relativism and idealism.
Measures the degree to which moral traits are central to one's self-concept.
Identifies personal values priorities across ten universal value types.
Measures sensitivity to disgust across different domains, which correlates with certain moral judgments.
Examines how moral values influence interpersonal relationships and social interactions.
Evaluates ethical decision-making in business contexts and professional environments.
